description.summary: The angular.json file is a configuration file used in Angular projects to manage project settings, build configurations, and various other options related to the project's structure and behavior. It acts as a central configuration hub for the Angular CLI (Command Line Interface) and provides a way to define settings for different environments, specify build options, manage assets, and more. Overall, the angular.json file serves as a centralized configuration file for Angular projects, allowing developers to manage various aspects of their projects' setup, build process, and deployment.

notes.title: Directives

description.summary: Directives in Angular are essential because they allow you to extend HTML with custom behavior and create reusable components. They play a crucial role in enhancing code readability, maintainability, and reusability by encapsulating complex DOM manipulations and behavior into a single component.
Importance of Directives : Code Reusability, Encapsulation, Separation of Concerns
Challenges Without Directives: Code Duplication, DOM Manipulation in Controllers, Limited Reusability
